body_html:
Same issue, compiling in CentOS 6.7 with the latest master branch of both tensorflow and bazel, python 2.7.6, and using the devtoolset-2 install of gcc/g++ 4.8.2.

Otherwise my steps are identical to @akors, who has them two comments above mine (though I am not using the gpu build). Same fix solves the issue.

Edit: I also had to use the fix here:

#121

and add "-lrt" in order to get python to use the correct timing library since CentOS 6.* has an older glibc.

@vrv I am also happy to provide more info. My guess it's also due to bazel.
body_text:
Same issue, compiling in CentOS 6.7 with the latest master branch of both tensorflow and bazel, python 2.7.6, and using the devtoolset-2 install of gcc/g++ 4.8.2.
Otherwise my steps are identical to @akors, who has them two comments above mine (though I am not using the gpu build).  Same fix solves the issue.
Edit: I also had to use the fix here:
#121
and add "-lrt" in order to get python to use the correct timing library since CentOS 6.* has an older glibc.
@vrv I am also happy to provide more info.  My guess it's also due to bazel.
body:
Same issue, compiling in CentOS 6.7 with the latest master branch of both tensorflow and bazel, python 2.7.6, and using the devtoolset-2 install of gcc/g++ 4.8.2.

Otherwise my steps are identical to @akors, who has them two comments above mine (though I am not using the gpu build).  Same fix solves the issue.

Edit: I also had to use the fix here:

https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/121

and add "-lrt" in order to get python to use the correct timing library since CentOS 6.\* has an older glibc.

@vrv I am also happy to provide more info.  My guess it's also due to bazel.
